results.title: Catchwords: ideas for spelling
results.creator_credit: O. Hollander and Educational Technology Unit, Toorak State College
results.brief_description: Charles Cripps, author of the spelling manual “Catchwords” is interviewed by Sue Brockfield and Howard Mould. Cripps outlines several strategies useful for the teaching of spelling. He strongly advocates the “look, cover, write and check” system which is explained during the interview.

results.creator_credit: Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture. Longerenong Campus

results.title: Catchment Boards at work: Nelson
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit and Apex Films
results.brief_description: How cultivation of the Nelson Province is being extended by scientific treatment of the soil; also, how further erosion is being prevented by control of the river catchments. Shows the co-ordinated program in the upper catchment areas and river control in the lower parts of the district. Commentary by Bill Beavis. Photography by George Hobbs.

results.title: Catching stripies: tuna fishing
results.creator_credit: Victoria. Dept. of Fisheries and Wildlife
results.brief_description: Shows experimental trials using new equipment and fishing techniques for catching striped tuna near Lakes Entrance in Victoria. Alos shows aspects of the work carried out on the fishing boat.

results.title: Catching stars of baseball
results.brief_description: An instructional film by four of America’s leading catchers in the major baseball leagues. Aimed at junoir baseballers where very few want to take a catcher’s job. Covers areas such as equipment required, stance, signals, throwing, catching, tactics and tagging.

results.title: Catching crocodiles
results.creator_credit: Efftee Film Productions and Noel Monkman
results.brief_description: This film, showing aspects of the life of crocodile hunters on the Gulf of Carpentaria, was one of eleven short Australian educational films produced by Efftee Studios as a result of a partnership between naturalist Noel Monkman and Frank Thring Snr. Monkman photographed and directed the films and Frank Thring Snr narrated most of them. Two series were produced: the “Barrier Reef” series which consisted of five films and the “Australian Marvelogue” series, of which “Catching Crocodiles” is one of six. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: Catapult
results.creator_credit: Andric Film Productions and Andrew Vial
results.brief_description: Catapult is a poetic film on the sport of pole vaulting and features dual Olympian Ray Boyd and Australian ex-champion Eddy Johnson. Both vaulters are seen in top form as they outdo each other in their attempts to set a new Australian pole vault record. Photographed and edited by Tony Paterson.

results.title: Catamarans
results.creator_credit: BBC-TV, West Region Film Unit and Ian Curtis
results.brief_description: Catamarans, those sailing craft originating from the Pacific with two slender hulls spread apart to give high sail-carrying and stability, have become very popular in England. David Lutyens commentates the film which shows various types of this boat, from the simplest model to the sixty-three foot long passenger craft, and ends with shots of a Catamaran Regatta.

results.title: Catalysis
results.brief_description: A study of catalysis as fourth factor in the velocity of chemical reactions. Explains how catalyst function by absorbing molecules, activating molecules forming an intermediate compound, or starting a chain reaction. Illustrates application of negative catalysts in the manufacture of rubber and anti-knock gasoline.
